# H2O

## Description
Level: easy<br/>
Author: PS

Just some Hâ‚‚O ...

```

```

## Solution

From the challenge name we can guess that the flag is encoded as octal and then hex twice. So we simply reverse that and
get:

```
ðŸ˜€ðŸŒŠ 68 65 62 30 32 62 7b 68 171 64 72 60 67 33 156 5f 6e 137 30 78 171 67 33 156 7d
```

Using from hex on this again yields `heb02b{h..G&.s1V_n.s..qg3.g`. This seems partially correct but some letters are
wrong. We have to decode every third character as octal and all other characters as hex:

```python
all = [ 0x68, 0x65, 0o62, 0x30, 0x32, 0o62, 0x7b, 0x68, 0o171, 0x64, 0x72, 0o60, 0x67, 0x33, 0o156, 0x5f, 0x6e, 0o137, 0x30, 0x78, 0o171, 0x67, 0x33, 0o156, 0x7d ]

for c in all:
    print(chr(c), end='')
```

This prints the flag `he2022{hydr0g3n_n_0xyg3n}`.
